intro: Alloplectus speciosus, commonly known as the showy spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features showy yellow flowers surrounded by brightly colored bracts, making it visually striking. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies. Alloplectus speciosus is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
